Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya, Arshdeep Singh and Jasprit Bumrah delivered for their captain to secure a vice-like squeeze in the final
Suryakumar Yadav pulled off a clutch catch in the deep to dismiss David Miller
Heinrich Klaasen monstered five sixes in a 27-ball 52, leaving South Africa needing 26 runs off the last four overs
Pre-Game Insights: Virat Kohli’s 59-ball 76 stitched India together in the first innings
South Africa tipped into favourites status with eight straight wins, including a few thrillers
Rohit Sharma’s men had a relatively frictionless unbeaten cruise to the final but were ultimately thwarted in the 50-over World Cup campaign on home soil late last year
Post-Match Reflections: Sharma expressed pride in the boys and acknowledged the fans’ support
Kohli said it was a now or never situation for his last T20 game playing for India
Aiden Markram, the South African captain, described the loss as gut-wrenching
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shastri delivered his best Michael Buffer impression at the toss
Axar Patel gave India impetus by clearing the rope four times for a 31-ball 47
Klaasen held two sparkling catches as India slumped to 34 for three
Others: Ravi Shastri had delivered his best Michael Buffer impression at the toss
Shivam Dube added 27 in 16 balls and Kohli eventually blossomed at the back end by slotting 26 off his last 11 deliveries
The pick was probably when Quinton de Kock’s lasered throw from wicketkeeper ran out Axar Patel in the 14th over, displaying remarkable presence of mind in contrast to his slightly dozing mark
